title: mop999
author: mop999
content: Hay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: Are online courses necessary for crypto trading? I did not went through anyone courses, all that I did was that I used the trading guide or articles that were provided buy the exchanges that I was using at the time. HitBTC is not recommended because of too high fee and many freezing of accounts that people complained about, but I used some of their trading guide until I moved to Binance. You can use Binance trading guides for everything and just use like $11 to learn it. I will advice you to forget about anything like demo account, use like $11 to learn.

comments.author: GeorgeJohn
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMHay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!In this point that you are curious trading, i think that within your geographical environment you have a perfect person who can teach you exactly what you will do through trading, because in my country many people learn trading through manual and those shops or business center for trading is many, so since you have decided to learn outside it's better. Definitely you comprehend well and obtain vital informations of trading because it's manual.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: If you think after joining a booth camp, training group, private tutor, limited trading signal etc you will always make money, you're totally wrong. Those self pro claimed professional trader or tutor are only learn about multiple trading sources that you can access free with google. Which mean they just tell you about the basic and it's really not important at all. Actually if they can make money in trading, why they need to teach to everyone?

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: These free materials where will give you an idea of how to trade day/swing. You just have to take time on finding the right one. But I've seen some groups that offer this type of lesson and are managed by one really actual trader. I understand that they can earn from all of their trades but they're just saying that they're doing it for the people to have knowledge in trading and they just want to give back to the community but it's paid. In our local, there are a lot of it but I don't recommend it, try this TA lessons from binance academy.(https://academy.binance.com/en/articles?page=1&tags=technical-analysis)

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Tom Dante is the only person that I can think of that offers mentoring, however I can't attest to his abilities and the price he mentioned is pretty expensive, so at least you should think of the offer twice.Second, if I may offer you some advise, try not to measure your progress on the market by how fast or slow you are, as the majority of elite traders take years, if not decades, to effectively carry out their trading plans. The best way to get your feet wet and feel comfortable with swing/day trading, if you haven't before, is to actually try making a few tiny trades.At the end of the day, what matters the most is your execution based on your learnings not only from course materials but also from your own loses/wins.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.created_time: December 26, 2022, 12:26:38 PMLast edit: December 26, 2022, 01:22:43 PM by EarnOnVictor
comments.body: This will take you time and energy, you should also be ready to read from many authors to gain the needed knowledge. And since it's about the day and swing trading strategies the OP is seeking, my advice for you is that you should not search based on cryptocurrency alone for you to have wider resources to tap from. The best is to search through many means possible as traditional trading would have more explanations on this than the new cryptocurrency articles. Once you know one, you know all, and it would be your responsibility to study the behaviour of different markets to act accordingly.Emphatically, you should avoid much social media nonsense on this. I know many people would furnish you with some online mentors, you should be wise, many have tried them but gained almost nothing. My advice for you is to continue reading online by yourself or find a dedicated teacher on this that might engage you alone per the time of training. Read articles that are written by trusted names or sites, especially the ones that work with brokers and exchanges. I learned online through this means, and I am making regular money for some years now.

comments.author: Eternad
comments.body: Are you looking for free group or courses that will teach you trading lessons or a paid lecture is still an option because there are a lot of free and paid trading courses on Udemy which can give you a proper lesson on trading instead of looking for a specific trading group because most of the free groups usually offer pump and dump scheme trading.Udemy is the website where I learn how to use indicator properly and how to read chart to use it on my trading.

comments.author: Ararbermas
comments.body: Trainer will be a great idea aside of having a tutor because studying is really useful and you can really gain a lot of information and you can build your own strategy and etc, wherein you don't need someone to rely once you have problems or you end up in a bad situation as it will become so easy to fix on your own.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMHay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!There are good tutors out there, but looking for a tutor will cost you some money and in the end you might not even get what you want , while some may require you pay more money for further knowledge, talking from experience. It will be nice if you use free sources available to learn, like the YouTube, a lot of information that will help you is in the YouTube. Secondly the Binance Academy already provided to you is another good source you can use and have rest of mind learning and it will only require just data subscription.

comments.author: beerlover
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMI was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?You may get some tutor who got plenty of experiences on teaching what books say but I am highly sceptical about finding a professional trader who could teach you along the way they are trading for themselves. When I tried to hire a mentor for my forex trading, the people, I met were all ex-traders who aspired a living out of trading but failed by losing all the capital. It means you may get some traders with good experience on trading but there could be very lesser chances for them to be still into trading.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: I only ever used Tradingview for following some guides and tips on cryptocurrencies, and used Reddit whenever possible (and whenever useful, lol) in order to add to what I learned from tradingview. Nowadays there are tons of institutions and people offering 1 on 1 coaching for trades and decision-making in a real-world trading scenario, though that doesn't come cheap and there isn't any guarantee that you'll learn all of the things you wanted to learn in such a short span of time. If I were you, I'd do copy trading first, then if the trade is successful try to read about the decision second - though of course, you don't have to do this every time, just some trades you're quite unsure of but a lot of the traders picked it anyway. You get to learn things more by doing and not reading, so start small and don't get your emotions in the way and you'll be fine.

comments.author: ShowOff
comments.body: Quote from: Plaguedeath on December 26, 2022, 09:46:39 AMIf you think after joining a booth camp, training group, private tutor, limited trading signal etc you will always make money, you're totally wrong. Those self pro claimed professional trader or tutor are only learn about multiple trading sources that you can access free with google.Tutors from experienced traders are far more likely to make beginners fully understand what they are learning. You shouldn't blame beginners and keep suggesting that they just learn on their own through Google articles, after all, not everyone is able to do it and understand it properly without guidance. OP can learn a lot from experienced traders, it will also be useful.Quote from: Plaguedeath on December 26, 2022, 09:46:39 AMWhich mean they just tell you about the basic and it's really not important at all. Actually if they can make money in trading, why they need to teach to everyone?Let's just say it's a fee service, because basically nothing is free in this world.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: You will only run into scammers this way. Nobody who can actually trade for a profit will teach you their skill so you can compete with their profits.All those tutors are scams. They teach you the basics but it’s actually very difficult to be profitable that way. Most traders just learn their own way if they are dedicated enough.

comments.author: mop999
comments.body: Quote from: Eternad on December 26, 2022, 01:08:43 PMAre you looking for free group or courses that will teach you trading lessons or a paid lecture is still an option because there are a lot of free and paid trading courses on Udemy which can give you a proper lesson on trading instead of looking for a specific trading group because most of the free groups usually offer pump and dump scheme trading.Udemy is the website where I learn how to use indicator properly and how to read chart to use it on my trading.ya have a bunch of cources form there on tec analysis and other things my strategy was to get some one to teach me some day trading and review stuff after i gain actual trade experince.the other thing i was thinking of is if there is a group that foucs maninly on making small trades or what ever amounts to just get practile experince, where its about gaining practicle experince my main issue was how to gain practical experince dosent even have to be a trainer/tutor if experince can be gianed

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 27, 2022, 06:13:17 AMthe other thing i was thinking of is if there is a group that foucs maninly on making small trades or what ever amounts to just get practile experince, where its about gaining practicle experinceOn youtube and telegram you'll get a bunch of ppl sharing their expiriences practically, but remember that the serious and big players dont chat often and are not interested in sharing practical knowledge everytime (since they are too busy with themselves all the time), and beware of some ppl asking money for giving knowledge, most turn out to be scammers.Quote from: mop999 on December 27, 2022, 06:13:17 AMmy main issue was how to gain practical experinceThere is a well-known saying: "Nature is the best teacher". Here, market will teach you itself. Trade with 1$-5$ and slowly you will know everything by yourself, and learn to observe carefully before taking any major actions, if you learn this skill you will be on top soon. Remember, "Observation makes you a master!"

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMI have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!I think you will have to stop looking for what does not exist. Most times the experience we need or asking for is to be persistence in the little we have learnt or know. No knowledge is waste, build on what you know because most of what you are asking for is the same with what you already know. Put yourself into more demo trading and build yourself in strategy, then you can trade live with very little money to build proper emotion and real live trade experience.

comments.author: Findingnemo
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMHay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!IMO, its an useless expense because you're not going to learn anything new by hiring a tutor and if I am not wrong they can teach you about how to trade only and some analysis which is good but not mandatory cause you can learn it from free guides itself and practice it in demo account then before going with big amount.

comments.author: jaberwock
comments.body: Quote from: Findingnemo on December 27, 2022, 02:43:04 PMQuote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMHay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!IMO, its an useless expense because you're not going to learn anything new by hiring a tutor and if I am not wrong they can teach you about how to trade only and some analysis which is good but not mandatory cause you can learn it from free guides itself and practice it in demo account then before going with big amount.He seems not confident enough with the ability that he currently have and he thinks that hiring a mentor will make him improve. Well there is no problem with that and that is why services like this are created. They are still helpful for someone who is lost and don't know where to start.A good mentor can teach us a lot of things, not only the basic ones but there are advanced lessons too that we haven't came across yet. The only thing that a mentor can't give to us is experience. To be able to obtain it. One must engage in the actual trade and apply what he learned. They can also start with a demo trade (as you suggested) before proceeding on the real thing.

comments.author: South Park
comments.body: Quote from: mop999 on December 26, 2022, 03:20:43 AMHay Everyone I was wondering if any of you know of affordable Tutor (sites or local) or Trainers or even group (example: meet.com or reedit etc..) or anything else I am missing, where I can learn an gain experience day/swing trading crypto more effectively so I can shorten my learning cure a bit and gain real trading experience quicker vie in person trading  (training/tutor) or online , I have gone through some online Courses out of curiosity and did few minor trades all ready and want to get experience live day/swing trading?-Much appreciate any help, Thanks!How much money are you willing to spend? Because this is very expensive and if you are short on funds this could make it even harder to begin your trading journey, in my opinion if you want to shorten the time needed to get used to trading or investing then you have no other option but to dedicate all the time you can to reading books about the topic, and then only once you have done this for a few months then you could make use of a tutor and get the most out of the experience.
